item.description:
Hello Everyone, I am so Excited about this meetup!  Come enjoy the beautiful White Mountains of NH during prime foliage season


Meet us in the parking lot at the Cannon Mountain Tramway at 10am..we plan to be on the bikes for 10:30am...  From there we will ride the Franconia Notch Bike Trail.

The trail is approximately 8.8 miles in each directions so our total miles will be 17.6 miles.  You can use road, hybrid or mountain bikes here.. the path is paved.

The Franconia Notch Recreation Path contains hills, bike-walk areas and an elevation gain of approximately 800 feet from south to north. Please obey signs and use caution when needed there will be some hilly areas. http://www.cannonmt.com/recpath.html

If you would prefer not to bring your bike they do have Bike rentals at the Tram here is their website:  http://www.cannonmt.com/bike_rentals.html

Once we complete the bike path (which should not take us more then two hours) we will break for lunch... and eat at the top of Cannon.. To get there we will Ride the Aerial Tramway to the Summit of Cannon Mountain.  The cost is $14 per person. Either bring your lunch with you or there is a cafeteria & bar at the top of the mountain.

http://www.cannonmt.com/cannontram.html

An 80-passenger cable car brings visitors to the 4,080-foot summit of Cannon Mountain in under ten minutes. On a clear day, you can see the mountains of four states and Canada! At the summit, you'll find spectacular scenic walking paths, a 360 degree observation deck, a cafeteria, bar and restrooms.

- Soar through the air to remarkable heights
- New Hampshire's highest lift-accessed point
- An exciting ride for all ages
- Stunning views of New Hampshire, Maine, Vermont, New York and Canada
- A must-see attraction!

If you choose not to go to the top there are some easy hiking paths you can take advantage of such as: Artists Bluff - Short Hike - Great Views

After we complete our adventure we will head to the Woodstock Inn Station & Brewery in North Woodstock, NH.. our goal is to get there about 5:30.. I will make a reservation.

For those that are interested in staying in the Mountains for the weekend.. go to the home page of the Cannon Mountain Website where they list many different lodging options:

http://www.cannonmt.com/summer.html
item.how_to_find_us: We will be in the parking lot for the Cannon MountainTram.. We will try to find a corner where we are away from everyone..
item.name: Ride the Franconia Notch Bike Trail & Soar up Aerial Tramway to Top of Cannon Mt
